message.entry: Input data type must be double precision or single precision.
The variance input must be of the same data type as the signal input.
The EbNo, EsNo, SNR, BitsPerSymbol, SignalPower, SamplesPerSymbol and Variance properties, when applicable, must be row vectors of the same length or scalar.
The EbNo, EsNo, SNR, BitsPerSymbol, SignalPower, SamplesPerSymbol and Variance properties, when applicable, must be scalars when the input number of channels changes.
The input number of channels must match the length of those non-scalar properties including EbNo, EsNo, SNR, BitsPerSymbol, SignalPower, SamplesPerSymbol and Variance when applicable.
The VAR input must be a scalar or a vector with dimensions [1 {0,number,integer}]
The {0} property must be a scalar or a row vector with a length equal to the number of channels.
The {0} property must be a scalar or a row vector with a length equal to the number of channels.
The {0} property must be a scalar or a row vector with a length equal to the number of channels.
The {0} property must be a scalar or a row vector with a length equal to the number of channels.
The {0} property must be a scalar or a row vector with a length equal to the number of channels.
The {0} property must be a scalar or a row vector with a length equal to the number of channels.
The {0} property must be a scalar or a row vector with a length equal to the number of channels.
The variance input must be a scalar or a vector with the same number of channels as the signal input.
